channel.title: Comments on: How Do Professional Tennis Players Make A Living?
channel.description: Your secret weapon on the court.

item.title: By: Chad Walner
item.dc:creator: Chad Walner
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/how-do-professional-tennis-players-make-a-living/#comment-388">Ovie Ainenehi</a>.
Well if you want them to make money from tennis, there is a very slim chance. You'd have to spend a small fortune just to give them a chance as well.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ovie Ainenehi.

Well if you want them to make money from tennis, there is a very slim chance. You’d have to spend a small fortune just to give them a chance as well.

item.title: By: Ovie Ainenehi
item.dc:creator: Ovie Ainenehi
item.description: This has been an insightful and eye opening read. I love tennis and hope to nudge my children into that line, but with this revelation, I might just rethink
item.content:encoded: This has been an insightful and eye opening read. I love tennis and hope to nudge my children into that line, but with this revelation, I might just rethink

item.title: By: j
item.dc:creator: j
item.description:
"For example, many of the minor Futures tournaments pay the winner $15,000."
Do your research before writing your next article.
item.content:encoded:
“For example, many of the minor Futures tournaments pay the winner $15,000.”

Do your research before writing your next article.

item.title: By: Jeff Weissler
item.dc:creator: Jeff Weissler
item.description: You should check out Behind The Racquet on Instagram. Stories from "middle of the road" pro tennis players about what its like on tour. Hard to believe someone ranked the 150th best tennis player in The World can barely feed themselves at the end of the year. Some heart wrenching stories. In addition, this week's The Coffee Cast with Mike Cation talks about the inequalities of the top 8 players & all the rest. Perhaps there will be an uprising with the younger players as they are the future of tennis. I have been playing tennis & watching tennis for over 56 years & can't understand why it can't be fairer.
item.content:encoded: You should check out Behind The Racquet on Instagram. Stories from “middle of the road” pro tennis players about what its like on tour. Hard to believe someone ranked the 150th best tennis player in The World can barely feed themselves at the end of the year. Some heart wrenching stories. In addition, this week’s The Coffee Cast with Mike Cation talks about the inequalities of the top 8 players & all the rest. Perhaps there will be an uprising with the younger players as they are the future of tennis. I have been playing tennis & watching tennis for over 56 years & can’t understand why it can’t be fairer.
